frame.name: FR_Spending
frame.definition:
<def-root>This frame involves a <fen>Spender</fen> paying <fen>Money</fen>, possibly either in order to accomplish a <fen>Purpose</fen>, get some <fen>Goods</fen>, or because of a certain <fen>Cause_of_expense</fen>. For some LUs, the origin of the expense is expressed as the worker providing labor instead of the goods (FR: frais de vétérinaire), hence the <fen>Seller</fen> FE.
<ex></ex> Distinctions with other frames: <ex></ex>
≠ <frframe>FR_Giving_money</frframe> : in the FR_Spending, the <fen>Recipient</fen> cannot be locally expressed.
<ex></ex> <asf>Relation to fndata-1.5</asf> New in ASFALDA. </def-root>

FE.name: Spender
FE.definition:
<def-root>The <fen>Spender</fen> has the <fen>Money</fen> and wants to obtain the <fen>Goods</fen>, or wants the <fen>Purpose</fen> to be accomplished. <ex>FR-EX: <fex name="Byr">Les Français</fex> <t>dépensaient</t> 69,5 milliards de francs à l'étranger</ex> <ex>FR-EX: <fex name="Cause_of_expense">L'intégration des étudiants</fex> a <t>coûté</t> <fex name="Money">1,2 milliards</fex> à <fex name="Spender">l'Etat</fex> en 1992. </ex>
</def-root>

FE.name: Goods
FE.definition: <def-root>The FE Goods is anything (including labor or time, for example) which is exchanged for Money in a transaction. <ex>FR-EX: Le gouvernement a <t>dépensé</t> près de 3 milliards de dollars en <fex name="Gds">infrastructures rurales</fex></ex></def-root>

FE.name: Money
FE.definition: <def-root>Money is what is spent, potentially in order to accomplish the <fen>Purpose</fen> or acquire the <fen>Goods</fen>. <ex>FR-EX: Les Français <t>dépensaient</t> <fex name="Money">69,5 milliards de francs</fex> à l'étranger</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Seller
FE.definition: <def-root>The <fen>Seller</fen> has possession of the <fen>Goods</fen> and exchanges them for <fen>Money</fen> from a <fen>Buyer</fen>. <ex>FR-EX: Les <t>frais</t> de <fex name="Seller">notaire</fex> sont élevés.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Rate
FE.definition: <def-root>In some cases, price or payment is described per unit of Goods. <ex>FR-EX:Sam <t>dépense</t> <fex name="Rate">300 euros par mois</fex>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Way_of_expense
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE characterizes what the <fen>Money</fen> is (currency or some metaphorical indication of what is spent). <ex>FR-EX: Les Français <t>dépensaient</t> <fex name="Money">69,5 milliards</fex> en <fex name="Way_of_expense">francs</fex>.</ex> </def-root>

FE.name: Unit
FE.definition: <def-root>This FE is any unit in which goods or services can be measured. Generally, it occurs in a <ment>by</ment>-PP. <ex>Bob <t>pays</t> for peppers <fex name="Unit">by the pound</fex>. </ex></def-root>

FE.name: Purpose
FE.definition: <def-root>The purpose meant to be accomplished with the <fen>Spender</fen>'s <fen>Money</fen>. <ex>FR-EX: Le gouvernement a <t>dépensé</t> beaucoup d' argent pour <fex name="Purpose">réduire les très impopulaires listes d'attente</fex>. </ex></def-root> </def-root>

FE.name: Cause_of_expense
FE.definition: <def-root>The situation that causes the <fen>Spender</fen> spending some <fen>Money</fen>. <ex>FR-EX: <fex name="Cause_of_expense">L'avantage fiscal accordé</fex> <t>coûtera</t> 3 milliards. </ex></def-root> </def-root>
